page.title: 09Housing in Debenham.
page.content: Debenham has doubled in area since 1960 Considerable house-building took place in the early 1960s on several estates and some council houses were built,too. The new houses are near to the village centre yet hidden by the historic facade of the older part of the village The most recent addition has been the Barratts development,which is still under construction.On existing estates such as Gardeners Road,gaps have been filled and extensions built. Both estate agents report that house prices within the village itself are higher than those in surrounding areas. This is because this is a self-contain- ed village with good communications with centres of employment such as Stowmarket and Ipswich.Demand is part- icularly high for period properties and houses in need of renovation.There is little private,rented accommodation.
